title: Helping Others Improve EP 16.

embed.description: This is part of a series, where I try and help others go from Bronze to silver. Heck maybe even gold. Im not the one playing, Im spectating a game. If you are bronze and want some help, let me know.

body: That dorin ring first item tho, can someone help explain why?

replies.body:
Hey this is really cool! 

When I have some time I might go watch a few more of your videos.

Quick tip first off is it might make a better view experience if you learned the spectator hotkeys.

http://vignette3.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/7/73/Spectator_Mode_Hotkeys.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20130904052709

I'm learning!
If only school taught me this stuff.

Yeah, I really need to sit down and learn.
I've been meaning too, I just keep forgetting.
This is fun to watch. Keep it coming, Yasei
Ty, also did you send me a friend request?

Yep I did. I also want to help bronzes too.
By the way, grats for Gold

Ok, I can have you there so if I'm away you can try and give advice.
I'm not entirely sure how things will work tho XD

Dorans is OK on GP I think it is meant to be a better start into a ranged matchup or just a farm lane. I'd take corrupting into nasus and look to bully nasus as much as possible early rather than opting into a farm lane, gp has a decent matchup early with his passive and q harass. Both scale well but nasus hits a tanky point earlier than GP hits his dmg items.

Best advice I could give for lower rank people playing GP:
- Watch youtube videos how to tripple barrel correctly, make a custom, practice until you can consistently pull it off.
- Don't play too ham early, if you are even or ahead usually due to scaling this is a big win.
- Use ur ult for other lanes as much as possible, this is one of the strongest parts of the kit. You can win other lanes for your team by simply paying attention to the map.
- TP early not late because GP needs time to set barrels.

Consistency is the key, consistent good decisions, consistent good barrel play, consistent good map awareness.
That's good advice, Ill link him to what you said.
